alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Muskogee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 02 at 5:49PM CST until January 02 at 6:45PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CST FOR SOUTHEASTERN WAGONER...SOUTHWESTERN CHEROKEE AND NORTHEASTERN MUSKOGEE COUNTIES... At 549 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located 3 miles east of Muskogee, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Muskogee... Tahlequah... Fort Gibson... Okay... Hulbert... Sequoyah State Park... Lost City... HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for northeastern and east central Oklahoma. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
